tests

Class DGABHTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.DGABHTest

  • public class DGABHTest
extends java.lang.Object
    A test driver class for testing the BH.DGABH class for mathematical optimization implementing the Generalized Adaptive Basin Hopping method in a parallel/distributed version.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke from the command-line as: java -cp <classpath> tests.DGABHTest <params_file> [random_seed] [maxfuncevals]. The params_file must contain lines of the following form:
        • class,dgabh.function, <fullclassname>[,args] mandatory, specifies the full java class name of the function to be optimized (implementing the popt4jlib.FunctionIntf interface.) The function must accept popt4jlib.VectorIntf objects as args.
        • class,dgabh.randomparticlemaker,<fullclassname>[,args] mandatory, the full class name of the popt4jlib.RandomChromosomeMakerIntf object responsible for creating valid random chromosome Objects to populate the islands. Notice that in most cases, including the one where the actual class responsible for creating valid random chromosome objects is the popt4jlib.BH.DblArray1VectorCMaker, the params file must contain the following extra params that are needed for chromosome creation:
        • dgabh.chromosomelength,$integer_value$ mandatory, the length of the chromosome.
        • dgabh.minallelevalue,$value$ mandatory, the min value for any allele in the chromosome.
        • dgabh.minallelevalue$i$,$value$ optional, the min value for the i-th allele in the chromosome ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,chromosome_length-1}). If this value is less than the global value specified by the "[dgabh.]minallelevalue" key, it is ignored.
        • dgabh.maxallelevalue,$value$ mandatory, the maximum value for any allele in the chromosome.
        • dgabh.maxallelevalue$i$,$value$ optional, the max value for the i-th allele in the chromosome ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,chromosome_length-1}). If this is greater than the global value specified by the "[dgabh.]maxallelevalue" key, it is ignored.
        • dgabh.numthreads,$num$ optional, how many threads will be used, default is 1. Each thread corresponds to an island in the DGA model.
        • class,dgabh.c2amaker,<fullclassname> optional, the object implementing popt4jlib.Chromosome2ArgMakerIntf that is responsible for tranforming a chromosome Object to a function argument Object. If not present, the default identity transformation is assumed.
        • class,dgabh.a2cmaker,<fullclassname>[,args] optional, the object implementing popt4jlib.Arg2ChromosomeMakerIntf that is responsible for transforming a FunctionIntf argument Object to a chromosome Object. If not present, the default identity transformation is assumed. The a2c object is not only useful when other ObserverIntf objects register for this SubjectIntf object and also add back solutions to it (as FunctionIntf args), but also because the local-optimization process that is part of the Basin-Hopping algorithm, may work on a different representation space than the one the Basin-Hopping works (though there does not seem to be any benefit from such a transformation).
        • dgabh.numgens, $num$; optional, the number of iterations to run the DGABH algorithm, default is 1.
        • dgabh.immprob, $val$ optional, the probability with which a sub-population will send some of its members to migrate to another (island) sub-population, default is 0.01.
        • dgabh.numinitpop,$num$ optional, the initial population number for each island, default is 10.
        • class,[dgabh.]immigrationrouteselector,<fullclassname>[,args] optional, the full class name of the popt4jlib.ImmigrationIslandOpIntf object defining the routes of immigration from island to island; default is null, which forces the built-in unidirectional ring routing topology.

          Notice that for all keys above if the exact key of the form "dgabh.X" is not found in the params, then the params will be searched for key "X" alone so that if key "X" exists in the params, it will be assumed that its value corresponds to the value of "dgabh.X" originally sought.

        • rndgen,$num$,$num2$ mandatory, specifies the starting random seed to use for each of the $num2$ threads to use (the value num2 must equal the number given in the line for dgabh.numthreads). The value of num should be a positive integer.
        • dbglvl,$num$ optional, sets the debugging level for this run. Debug level of 0 (zero) essentially prevents any debugging statements produced via calls to utils.Messenger to be printed; higher numbers produce more verbose output. Default is +Infinity which allows all debugging calls utils.Messenger.msg(stmt,lvl); to be printed.
        • class,dgabh.chromosomeperturber,<fullclassname>[,args] mandatory, the object implementing popt4jlib.BH.ChromosomePerturberIntf responsible for producing new individuals that are (presumably small) perturbations of an original starting individual. Extra parameters that the implementing perturber object requires must also be present. The extra parameters, when the perturber object is of class popt4jlib.BH.VectorIntfRndDeltaCPerturber are the following:
        • dgabh.delta,$value$ mandatory, the maximum delta perturbation that may occur for any vector component.
        • dgabh.maxperturbations,$num$ optional, the maximum number of components of the input vector that may be modified. Default is the length of the vector.
        • [dgabh.]minallelevalue,$value$ optional, the minimum value for any allele in the chromosome. Default -Infinity.
        • [dgabh.]minallelevalue$i$,$value$ optional, the minimum value for the i-th allele in the chromosome ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,chromosome_length-1}. If this value is less than the global value specified by the "[dgabh.]minallelevalue" key, it is ignored.
        • [dgabh.]maxallelevalue,$value$ optional, the maximum value for any allele in the chromosome. Default +Infinity.
        • [dgabh.]maxallelevalue$i$",$value$ optional, the max value for the i-th allele in the chromosome ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,chromosome_length-1}. If this value is greater than the global value specified by the "[dgabh.]maxallelevalue" key, it is ignored.
        • class,dgabh.localoptimizer,<fullclassname>[,args] optional, the object implementing popt4jlib.LocalOptimizerIntf that is responsible for performing a local-search around a starting point and returning the best individual found by local-search. Missing such a line implies no local-search process. As with above, any additional parameters that the implementing locOpt object requires must also be present. As an example, for the case where local optimizer is chosen to be the popt4jlib.GradientDescent.AlternatingVariablesDescent class, no extra arguments are mandatory, but it may be worth setting the
        • avd.numtries,$val$ optional line setting the total number of outer major iterations of this local optimizer, as well as the
        • avd.niterbnd,$val$ optional line that sets the number of inner iters after which the seach-step size is multiplied by the avd.multfactor number (default for the latter is 2)
        • class,dgabh.pdbtexecinitedwrkcmd,<fullclassname>[args] optional, if present, the full class name of the initialization command to send to the network of workers to run function evaluation tasks, followed by the constructor's arguments if any; default is null, indicating no distributed computation.
        • dgabh.pdbthost, <hostname> optional, the name of the server to send function evaluation requests, default is localhost.
        • dgabh.pdbtport, $num$ optional, the port the above server listens to for client requests, default is 7891.

        if the second optional argument is passed in, it overrides the random seed specified in the params_file.

        The optional third argument, if present, overrides any max. limit set on the number of function evaluations allowed. After this limit, the function will always return Double.MAX_VALUE instead, and won't increase the evaluation count.

        Parameters:
        args - String[]
